BASIC_CASE_INFORMATION.case_title: Nyamogo Nyamogo Advocates v Barclays Bank of Kenya
BASIC_CASE_INFORMATION.subject_matter: Breach of contract, injurious falsehood, libel, negligence

key_legal_issues: Breach of contract by failing to effect special clearance of a cheque
Measure of damages for wrongful dishonor of a cheque
Applicability of the Bills of Exchange Act
grounds_of_appeal: Errors in the trial court's application of law

OUTCOMES.trial_outcome: Awarded Kshs. 1 million for injurious falsehood and Kshs. 10,000 for breach of contract
OUTCOMES.costs_awarded: Costs of the suit and interest on damages from the date of judgment

legal_principles_established: Nominal damages for breach of contract
LEGAL_PRINCIPLES.precedent_value: Impacts banking practices and client relations in Kenya

procedural_history: Incident occurred on or about 3rd June 1998
Liability settled by consent on 15th May 2000
Appeal filed as Civil Appeal No. 69 of 2005
